message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.IR 

This paper deals with a semi-supervised learning algorithm for sentiment analysis, which falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP). Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also discusses the use of adaptive thresholds, which is a common technique in machine learning and falls under the category of artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The paper also involves comparisons of different experimental settings, which is a common practice in machine learning and falls under the category of machine learning (cs.LG). The paper also involves the use of computer vision techniques for sentiment analysis, which falls under the category of computer vision (cs.CV). Finally, the paper involves the use of information retrieval techniques for sentiment analysis, which falls under the category of information retrieval (cs.IR).
